medical_history.chief_complaint: Presence of a pedunculated scalp mass observed on ultrasound at 7 months gestation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The scalp mass was identified on ultrasound at 7 months of gestation and was examined two days after birth, showing a 2.5 x 1.0-cm yellow plaque with overlying erythematous pedunculated masses. These symptoms evolved from the prenatal observation to a postnatal examination without further aggravation or relief mentioned.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mother had a history of asthma and used inhalers and prednisone sporadically during pregnancy. The infant was otherwise healthy with a normal complete blood cell count; no other past medical conditions were specified.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of congenital malformations was noted.
medical_history.social_history: Mother smoked during the first trimester of pregnancy but denied alcohol and illicit drug use.
